channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. rock climber Alex Honnold reaches top of Taipei 101 skyscraper without ropes
item.description: Cheers erupted from a street-level crowd as Alex Honnold reached the top of the spire of the 508-meter (1,667-foot) tower, about 90 minutes after he started.
item.content:encoded:
Cheers erupted from a street-level crowd as Alex Honnold reached the top of the spire of the 508-meter (1,667-foot) tower, about 90 minutes after he started.

(Image credit: Chiang Ying-ying)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Here's how 'shared decision making' for childhood vaccines could limit access
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s new approach to six shots that were formerly given routinely will introduce new hurdles for getting kids immunized. And it could have a chilling effect on doctors.
item.content:encoded:
Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s new approach to six shots that were formerly given routinely will introduce new hurdles for getting kids immunized. And it could have a chilling effect on doctors.

(Image credit: PATRICK T. FALLON/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: 5 things to know about the latest Minneapolis shooting
item.description: Tensions are escalating in Minneapolis after Alex Jeffrey Pretti, a U.S. citizen, was killed during an encounter with immigration officials on Saturday morning. Here is what to know.
item.content:encoded:
Tensions are escalating in Minneapolis after Alex Jeffrey Pretti, a U.S. citizen, was killed during an encounter with immigration officials on Saturday morning. Here is what to know.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Thousands of new Americans opt for 'ultimate act of inclusion' despite obstacles
item.description: Three citizenship ceremonies NPR attended in the Washington, D.C. area in January were largely celebratory experiences, despite a year of hurdles and changes to the naturalization process.
item.content:encoded:
Three citizenship ceremonies NPR attended in the Washington, D.C. area in January were largely celebratory experiences, despite a year of hurdles and changes to the naturalization process.

(Image credit: Michael McCoy and Maansi Srivastava for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Anusha Mathur

item.title: 40 years after Challenger: Lingering guilt and lessons learned
item.description: Forty years after the Challenger disaster, NPR explores the engineers' last-minute efforts to stop the launch, their decades of guilt and the vital lessons that remain critical for NASA today.
item.content:encoded:
Forty years after the Challenger disaster, NPR explores the engineers' last-minute efforts to stop the launch, their decades of guilt and the vital lessons that remain critical for NASA today.

(Image credit: Thom Baur)
item.dc:creator: Howard Berkes

item.title: Russian strikes knock out heat in freezing Kyiv as peace talks continue
item.description: Russian strikes left much of Kyiv without heat, water and power during freezing temperature, even as Ukraine, Russia and the U.S. held talks on ending the nearly four-year war.
item.content:encoded:
Russian strikes left much of Kyiv without heat, water and power during freezing temperature, even as Ukraine, Russia and the U.S. held talks on ending the nearly four-year war.

(Image credit: Danylo Antoniuk)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Photos: Massive winter storm sweeps across the U.S.
item.description: A look at the extreme winter storm impacting two-thirds of the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
A look at the extreme winter storm impacting two-thirds of the U.S.

(Image credit: Nick Oxford)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Man shot dead by federal immigration officers in Minneapolis
item.description: The incident, which was caught on video, marks the second deadly shooting by federal officers in Minneapolis in less than a month.
item.content:encoded:
The incident, which was caught on video, marks the second deadly shooting by federal officers in Minneapolis in less than a month.

(Image credit: Erin Trieb for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Cheryl W. Thompson

item.title: A man is fatally shot by federal agents in Minneapolis
item.description: Federal agents have shot and killed another person in Minneapolis, this time a 51-year-old man.
item.content:encoded: Federal agents have shot and killed another person in Minneapolis, this time a 51-year-old man.
item.dc:creator: Eric Westervelt

item.title: Trump threatens Canada with 100% tariffs over its new trade deal with China
item.description: The announcement is a reversal for Trump, who initially initially praised the agreement with China as something Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney "should be doing."
item.content:encoded:
The announcement is a reversal for Trump, who initially initially praised the agreement with China as something Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney "should be doing."

(Image credit: Jacques Boissinot)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
